OrgName: General Motors Holdings LLC, its subsidiaries and affiliates, excluding General Motors Financial Company, Inc.: human resources data
activities:
As a global manufacturer of motor vehicles and provider of related services and technologies, GM processes human resources data, including human resources personal data, business personal data (such as business contact details and portrait pictures of data subjects) and IT systems personal data (such as email, calendars), whether collected on- or offline either directly or indirectly in connection with activities such as 1) carrying out and supporting its human resources functions and activities; 2) maintaining its obligations under employment contracts and law; 3) complying with applicable law and corporate policies; 4) implementing, investigating and reporting on employee compliance and discipline; 5) carrying out internal and legal investigations.  

GM also processes personal data regarding employees, contractors or other agents and contact persons of legal entities or individuals involved in actual or potential mergers, acquisitions or similar transactions. This includes personal data collected on- or offline either directly or indirectly.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Business Personal Data and Human Resource Data (as defined in Description of Activities).
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
